Key Match Events: Kieffer Moore scored a goal for Wales within 38 seconds.
Harry Wilson scored a long-range goal for Wales at the 3-minute mark.
Stefan Jovetic of Montenegro hit the bar from the halfway line.
Karl Darlow made a crucial save for Wales from a close-range shot by Stefan Jovetic.
Driton Camaj scored a goal for Montenegro in the second half.
Connor Roberts was forced off with a minor muscle injury and replaced by Brennan Johnson.
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy's side secured an opening draw with Turkey.
Montenegro lost 2-0 to Iceland in their previous match.
Wales made five changes to their lineup, with teenager Lewis Koumas starting in attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy watched his new-look side continue their aggressive, front-foot approach.
The victory added to Wales' initial draw with Turkey, earning them three valuable points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in driving rain, affecting the conditions.
There was a big penalty shout from Montenegro, but the referee waved away the protests.
